org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core

Class CvMat

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bytedeco.javacpp.Pointer
      • org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.AbstractArray
        • org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.CvArr
          • org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.AbstractCvMat
            • org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.CvMat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Indexable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractCvMat.ReleaseDeallocator
    Deprecated. 
    CvMat is now obsolete; consider using Mat instead.

    @Properties(inherit=opencv_core.class)
public class CvMat
extends AbstractCvMat
    Matrix elements are stored row by row. Element (i, j) (i - 0-based row index, j - 0-based column index) of a matrix can be retrieved or modified using CV_MAT_ELEM macro:

    uchar pixval = CV_MAT_ELEM(grayimg, uchar, i, j) CV_MAT_ELEM(cameraMatrix, float, 0, 2) = image.width*0.5f;

    To access multiple-channel matrices, you can use CV_MAT_ELEM(matrix, type, i, j\*nchannels + channel_idx).
